mlx.data.core.AWSFileFetcher.__init__ÔÉÅ

AWSFileFetcher.__init__(self: mlx.data._c.core.AWSFileFetcher, bucket: str, endpoint: str = '', region: str = '', prefix: os.PathLike = '', local_prefix: os.PathLike = '', ca_bundle: str = '', virtual_host: bool = False, verify_ssl: bool = True, connect_timeout_ms: int = 1000, num_retry_max: int = 10, num_connection_max: int = 25, buffer_size: int = 104857600, num_threads: int = 4, num_prefetch_max: int = 1, num_prefetch_threads: int = 1, num_kept_files: int = 0, access_key_id: str = '', secret_access_key: str = '', session_token: str = '', expiration: str = '', verbose: bool = False) → NoneÔÉÅ

Make an AWSFileFetcher to fetch files from S3.

Parameters

  • bucket (str) ‚Äì The S3 bucket to use.

  • endpoint (str) ‚Äì The endpoint to use.

  • region (str) ‚Äì The region to use.

  • prefix (str) ‚Äì The remote prefix to use for all files requested. (default: ‚Äò‚Äô)

  • local_prefix (str) ‚Äì The local cache directory to save the downloaded files in. (default: ‚Äò‚Äô)

  • ca_bundle (str) ‚Äì The path to a certificate authority file for establishing SSL/TLS connections. The environment variable AWS_CA_BUNDLE can also be used instead. (default: ‚Äò‚Äô)

  • virtual_host (bool) ‚Äì Whether to use virtual hosted style urls (ie the bucket in the domain part of the url). (default: false)

  • verify_ssl (bool) ‚Äì Whether we should verify SSL certificates. (default: true)

  • connect_timeout_ms (int) ‚Äì Assume it is a timeout after that many milliseconds. (default: 1000)

  • num_retry_max (int) ‚Äì How many times should we attempt to fetch a file before deciding that we failed. The retry strategy is exponential backoff. (default: 10)

  • num_connection_max (int) ‚Äì Specifies the maximum number of HTTP connections to the server. (default: 25)

  • buffer_size (int) ‚Äì Fetch the files in parts of that size. (default: 100MB)

  • num_threads (int) ‚Äì How many parts to fetch in parallel for each file. (default: 4)

  • num_prefetch_max (int) ‚Äì How many files to prefetch from the prefetch list. (default: 1)

  • num_prefetch_threads (int) ‚Äì How many files to prefetch in parallel from the prefetch list. (default: 1)

  • num_kept_files (int) ‚Äì How many files to keep in the local cache. If 0 we keep everything however if the files are larger than our local disk this should be set to a positive number. (default: 0)

  • access_key_id (str) ‚Äì Set the AWS access key id to authenticate to the remote service. (default: ‚Äò‚Äô)

  • secret_access_key (str) ‚Äì Set the AWS secret access key id to authenticate to the remote service. (default: ‚Äò‚Äô)

  • session_token (str) ‚Äì Set the AWS session token to authenticate to the remote service. (default: ‚Äò‚Äô)

  • expiration (str) ‚Äì A date string defining the expiration of the authentication credentials (default: ‚Äò‚Äô)

  • verbose (bool) ‚Äì Defines whether the file fetcher should write information messages to the standard output. (default: false)
